item.title: Arithmetic and marriage
item.description: Few days ago, I read a newspaper story. On suspecting that bridegrooms is illiterate, the bride put him under an arithmetic test: “how much is 15 + 6?”. And when the answer given was 17, she called off the marriage. A few childhood memories popped up. When I was a kid, my father asked me once: “how much is left when you subtract 2.75 out of 4.25?”. The question is hard when Hindustani is used to describe fractions.

item.title: Daadi and me ...
item.description: “You call every old lady Dadi Ji, Tai Ji. But why don’t you call your own dadi, Dadi ji. All the time you call her Buddhiya (old woman)?”, Papa used to scold me. So when he was around, I’d call my grandmother, Dadi - still not Dadi Ji. Calling her Dadi Ji was too much. These benign respectful words are for outsiders. She is a friend, very fast friend. When Papa was not around, I’d simply say “Oye Buddhi… ki haal chal…?
